<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS

9709/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 309, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 380, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 79, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 566, 102]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = 6x\cos \left(x^{2} + 1\right)\), find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to solve the inequality \(4^{x}< 0.05\). Give your answer in the form \(x< a\), where the value of \(a\) is correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 368, 185, 387]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 368, 425, 387]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(\left|3x + 8\right| < 9\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 368, 920, 387]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 770, 176, 789]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 770, 771, 789]]<|/det|>
Hence state the integers that satisfy both of the inequalities in parts (a) and (b).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 771, 917, 789]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 143, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 920, 116]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on a single diagram, the graphs of \(y = 3\mathrm{e}^{- 2x}\) and \(y = \sec x\) for values of \(x\) such that \(0\leqslant x< \frac{1}{2}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 410, 146, 428]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 410, 920, 450]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of the point of intersection of the two graphs satisfies the equation \(x = \frac{1}{2}\ln (3\cos x).\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 428, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 653, 144, 672]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 653, 920, 688]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part **(b)**, to find the \(x\)-coordinate of the point of intersection correct to 3 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 5 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 668, 920, 687]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 87, 606, 243]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 259, 920, 295]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = 6\mathrm{e}^{2x} - \mathrm{e}^{3x}\). The shaded region is bounded by the axes and the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 306, 146, 324]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 306, 554, 325]]<|/det|>
Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of the maximum point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 306, 917, 325]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 336, 917, 355]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 78, 146, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region. Give your answer in the form \(\frac{p}{q}\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 111]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 390, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 102, 608, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = a x^{3} + b x^{2} - a x - 24,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((2x - 3)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that the remainder is \(-15\) when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 183, 144, 201]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 183, 364, 201]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 183, 920, 201]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 415, 89]]<|/det|>
Hence factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 89]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 181, 521]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 504, 650, 521]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\mathrm{p}(3\mathrm{cos}\mathrm{e}\mathrm{c}\mathrm{\theta}) = 0\) for \(90^{\circ}< \theta < 270^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 521]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 430, 89]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 109, 626, 140]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{2t + 1}{3t + 4}, \qquad y = 2\ln (3t + 4),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 160, 240, 184]]<|/det|>
where \(t > - \frac{4}{3}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 201, 144, 218]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 196, 913, 222]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\) can be expressed in the form \(c(3t + 4)\) and state the value of the constant \(c\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 683, 91]]<|/det|>
It is given that the gradient of the curve at the point \((a, \ln 100)\) is \(m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 369, 121]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 693, 186, 710]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 693, 920, 727]]<|/det|>
State whether the curve represents a decreasing function or an increasing function or neither. Give a reason for your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 707, 920, 725]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 143, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 73, 494, 92]]<|/det|>
Prove that \(\sin^{2}2x + 4\cos^{2}x\cos 2x\equiv 4\cos^{4}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 580, 191, 599]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 580, 707, 599]]<|/det|>
Find the set of possible values of the constant \(k\) for which the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 603, 620, 625]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}2x + 4\cos^{2}x\cos 2x + 5 = k\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 632, 323, 651]]<|/det|>
has no real solutions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 632, 920, 651]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 144, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 589, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{-\frac{1}{3}\pi}^{\frac{1}{3}\pi} \sqrt{\sin^2 t + 4 \cos^2\left(\frac{1}{2} t\right)} \cos t \, \mathrm{d}t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
